de.esoco.lib.proxy.interception

Class InterceptionProxy<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.lib.proxy.interception.InterceptionProxy<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.obrel.core.Relatable

    public class InterceptionProxy<T>
extends org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
    Proxy implementation that intercepts method calls on an interface and forwards them to an application-specific interception handler.

    • Constructor Detail

      • InterceptionProxy

        public InterceptionProxy(java.lang.Class<T> rInterface)
        Creates a new instance. By default all method calls on created proxies will be forwarded to methods in target objects with the same name and parameters.
        Parameters:
        rInterface - The interface to be implemented by this proxy

      • InterceptionProxy

        public InterceptionProxy(java.lang.Class<T> rInterface,
                         boolean bRelationSupport)
        Creates a new instance for proxies that by default forward all method calls to the same methods in target objects. If the second argument is TRUE proxies created by this instance will support object relations even if the target object does not. The given proxy interface must extend the Relatable interface to provide access to relations.
        Parameters:
        rInterface - The interface to be implemented by this proxy
        bRelationSupport - TRUE to support object relations

    • Method Detail

      • getTarget

        public static java.lang.Object getTarget(java.lang.Object rProxyInstance)
        Returns the target object of a particular InterceptionProxy instance.
        Parameters:
        rProxyInstance - The proxy instance to return the target of
        Returns:
        The target object of the proxy instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the argument is not an instance of InterceptionProxy

      • addAdvice

        public void addAdvice(InterceptionAdvice rAdvice)
        Adds advice that will be executed around (i.e. before and/or after) the method calls of other interceptions. If other advice has been added previously the new advice will be executed around the first one(s) by successively invoking the advice instances.

        It is safe to add an InterceptionAdvice instance that has been used on another proxy before. If the argument advice object already contains a chained advice it will be copied by a call to it's clone() method. That implies that all InterceptionAdvice subclasses must implement a valid clone() method if they contain fields that need to be treated specially in clone().

        This functionality is modelled after the principles of aspect orientation and allows to apply certain crosscutting functions like logging to interceptions, independent of the actual function of the interception or the method(s) behind it.

        Parameters:
        rAdvice - The advice object to be added

      • getDefaultInterception

        public Interception getDefaultInterception()
        Returns the default interception of this proxy.
        Returns:
        The default interception (NULL if not set)

      • getInterception

        public Interception getInterception(java.lang.reflect.Method rMethod)
        Returns the interception for a certain method, or NULL if none has been set.
        Parameters:
        rMethod - The method for which to return the interception
        Returns:
        The matching (or default) interception or NULL

      • newProxyInstance

        public T newProxyInstance(java.lang.Object rTarget)
        Creates a new proxy instance that implements the interception proxy's interface and forwards call on that interface to a certain target object. What exactly this forwarding means depends on the interceptions used. For example, a value object interception could apply calls to set and get methods to a generic value container (like a Map).

        Attention: the created proxy instance remains connected to the interception settings in this proxy. That means that changes in the configuration of this proxy will be reflected in existing proxy instances. Unless such effects are desired it is recommended that once proxy instances have been created no more changes to the interception proxy configuration are made. This will prevent unexpected side effects.

        Parameters:
        rTarget - The target object of calls on the proxy interface
        Returns:
        An instance of the proxy interface using a LimitedAccessProxy instance to forward methods calls to the target

      • setDefaultInterception

        public void setDefaultInterception(Interception rDefault)
        Sets the default interception of this proxy that will be invoked if no method-specific interception can be found. The default setting of a new proxy instance will forward calls to the same method in the target object (if available).
        Parameters:
        rDefault - The default interception (NULL to disable)

      • setInterception

        public void setInterception(MethodInterception rInterception)
        Adds a method interception for all methods it is registered for.
        Parameters:
        rInterception - The method interception to add

      • setInterception

        public void setInterception(java.lang.String sMethod,
                            Interception rInterception)
        Sets an interception for a method of the proxy interface with a certain name and an arbitrary parameter list. If multiple methods with the same name exist the interception will be registered for all of them.
        Parameters:
        sMethod - The name of the method to intercept
        rInterception - The interception to be invoked in place of the method
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If

      • setInterception

        public void setInterception(java.lang.reflect.Method rMethod,
                            Interception rInterception)
        Adds an interception for a particular method to this proxy.
        Parameters:
        rMethod - The method to intercept
        rInterception - The interception to be used
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If one of the arguments is invalid

      • getDefinedInterception

        protected Interception getDefinedInterception(java.lang.reflect.Method rMethod)
        Returns the interception that has been defined for a certain method. Depending on the internal state this method will return either a specific interception for the given method or a default interception. If no interception matching interception has been defined an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        rMethod - The method for which to return the interception
        Returns:
        The matching interception
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If no interception has been defined for the given method (and no default interception exists)
